Authors: QingTao Zhang, Quan Lu, Ming He, XingYao Zhang
Title:
The analysis of rRNA sequence-structure in phylogenetics: An
application to pathogen of Cytospora canker on fruit tree in Asian
Keywords:
ITS1 rDNA, Secondary structure, Structural models, Valsa
mali var. mali, Valsa mali var. pyri, Valsa malicola, Valsa
ceratosperma
Abstract:
In this study, we investigated the primary sequence of
ITS1-5.8sRNA-ITS2 and secondary structure information from the internal
transcribed spacer (ITS1) of nuclear ribosomal DNA from Valsa mali
(included in V. ceratosperma complex), V. germanica, and V. malicola,
common fruit tree pathogens, within a phylogenetic framework. The
phylogenetic analyses based on primary sequences failed to resolve the
relationships among V. malicola, V. germanica, and a V. ceratosperma
strain (AF192324). Therefore, we combined sequence and structure
information and found that this approach allowed for the accurate
recognition of species within species complexes. The analysis further
suggested that the genetic divergence occurred in V. malicola.
Structural alignment and comparison with ITS1 sequence analysis
identified a variable region in a conserved structure formed from common
inverted repeats in most species in this study. The ITS1 secondary
structure types could correspond to the individual species and species
complexes. The combined sequence-structure approach applied in this
study accurately recognized the species within the species complexes,
for which primary sequences were unsatisfactory, poorly supported, or
lacking in resolution. The method demonstrated the importance of
including the secondary structure information in phylogenetic
analysis.
